intro: Eumachia haematocarpa, commonly known as the red-stemmed eumachia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, reddish stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. Its flowers are typically pale pink to white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Eumachia haematocarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
